title: Zucchini Slice
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 170C.
Step 2: Beat the eggs in a large bowl until combined. Add the flour and beat until smooth.
Step 3: Add the zucchini, onion, bacon, cheese and oil and stir to combine.
Step 4: Grease your cooking pan and pour the mixture into the pan and bake for 30 mins.

title: Easy Fried Rice
directions: Step 1: Cook the ricein a large saucepan of boiling water for 12 minutes or until tender. Drain and leave to cool.
Step 2: Heat oil in non-stick wok or large frying pan over medium heat. Add eggs and swirl over base to form an omelette. Cook for 2 minutes or until set.
Step 3: Transfer to a chopping board. Set aside to cool slightly.
Step 4: Add bacon to wok. Cook 4 minutes until light golden.
Step 5: Add carrot, shallots, peas and cooked rice and cook 3-4 minutes while stirring.
Step 6: Add egg and soy sauce and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and extra shallots and serve immediately.

title: Impossible Quiche
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (180g) grated Devondale Tasty Cheese Block (500g)
Salt & freshly ground pepper, to season
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 200Â°C. Grease a 5 cup capacity pie dish.
Step 2: Combine ham, onion, cheese, flour, salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Scatter over base of dish.
Step 3: Whisk eggs and milk together in a large jug and pour over ham mixture.
Step 4: Cook for about 40 minutes or until puffed and golden.
Step 5: Cool slightly. Serve warm or cold.

title: Thai Beef Salad
ingredients: 1 cucumber, halved lengthways, thinly sliced diagonally
1 red onion, halved, cut into thin wedges
2 long fresh red chillies, halved, deseeded, thinly sliced lengthways
1 bunch fresh mint, leaves picked, large leaves torn
1 bunch fresh Thai basil, leaves picked, large leaves torn
4 kaffir lime leaves, centre veins removed, finely shredded
directions: Step 1: Whisk together lime juice, garlic, fish sauce, sesame oil, soy sauce, ginger and palm sugar in a jug.
Step 2: Place the steak in a glass or ceramic dish. Drizzle with half the dressing. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge, turning occasionally, for 2 hours to develop the flavours.
Step 3: Transfer to a plate. Cover with foil and set aside for 10 minutes to rest.
Step 4: Place the tomato, cucumber, onion, chilli, mint, coriander, basil, peanuts and lime leaves in a large bowl.
Step 5: Thinly slice steak across the grain and add to the salad.
Step 6: Drizzle with remaining dressing and gently toss to combine. Divide salad among bowls and serve immediately.
